text: Panel type (ACM, IMP, corrugated) per approved shop drawings and submittals
Substrate prep materials, anchors, clips, subgirts, and sealants approved
Materials stored flat, dry, and protected from UV and physical damage
Structural supports/subgirts plumb, square, and fastened as per drawings
Back-up wall (sheathing, air barrier, insulation) complete before panel install
Control joints and expansion joints located as per architectural design
Panel layout follows approved elevation drawings (alignment, reveal lines)
ACM/IMP panels fastened with proper clips, screws, or concealed systems
Panel edges clean, straight, and protected with edge trims or finished reveals
Panel seams aligned, uniform spacing, and caulked (if exposed)
Protective film removed only after final inspection
Windows, doors, and louvers integrated with flashings and cladding system
External and internal corners detailed as per shop drawings
Transitions to other materials (e.g., stucco, masonry) sealed properly
Bottom of panels terminated above grade with proper closure
All exposed joints sealed with compatible, UV-stable caulking
No oil-canning, deformation, or color inconsistency visible
QA/QC review completed with punch list items addressed
Manufacturer warranty or closeout documentation submitted
